name: Awaken Divya Shakti - Seek Protection & Blessings of Maa Mundeshwari on Saptami
description: Mundeshwari Temple, located on the Kaimur hills in Bihar, is regarded as one of the oldest functional Hindu temples in India, with origins traced to around the 2nd century CE. The temple is dedicated primarily to Maa Mundeshwari (a form of Durga) and also houses a revered Shiva Lingam, symbolizing the confluence of Shakti and Shaiva traditions. Architecturally, the shrine is unique for its octagonal structure, built from sandstone with intricate carvings reflecting early Nagara-style influences. Despite partial damage over centuries, the temple remains an active center of worship, drawing devotees seeking protection, strength, and fulfillment of desires. A distinctive ritual associated with the temple is its symbolic animal offering. Unlike traditional animal sacrifices, the goat offered before the deity is only ritually touched and later revived, signifying devotion without bloodshed an uncommon practice in Shakti temples. ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§™‡•Ç‡§ú‡§æ (Every Lunar Month) Every month on Shukla Paksha Saptami, a special Durga Saptami Puja is performed with Vedic rituals. Devotees undertake: Sampoorna Durga Saptashati Path Havan (Agni ritual) Pushpanjali and coconut offering Chunari and shringar samarpan to Maa Many believe that prayers offered on Saptami at Mundeshwari Temple help remove obstacles, grant health, and fulfill heartfelt wishes. The spiritual energy of the hilltop shrine, combined with disciplined Vedic rites, makes every Saptami a highly auspicious occasion for seekers and devotees

name: Align the Nine Divine Forces: Invite Harmony, Prosperity & Cosmic Balance with Navgrah Pujan at Mangalnath
description: Navgrah Pujan at Mangalnath Mandir, Ujjain, is a sacred Vedic ritual performed to pacify and strengthen the nine planetary deities Surya, Chandra, Mangal, Budh, Guru, Shukra, Shani, Rahu, and Ketu. This puja is recommended for individuals facing persistent obstacles, health concerns, financial instability, or unfavorable planetary periods (Dasha/Antardasha). The ceremony includes Navgrah Shanti Jaap, special offerings, and havan conducted by learned priests as per Vedic traditions. Ujjain, historically known as a major center of astrology, is considered highly auspicious for performing planetary remedies. Navgrah Pujan aims to restore cosmic balance, enhance positive planetary influences, and bring harmony, prosperity, and spiritual stability into one‚Äôs life.

name: Heal Ancestral Karma with Pitra Dosh Nivaran Puja at Mangalnath
description: Pitra Dosh Nivaran Puja at Mangalnath Mandir, Ujjain, is a sacred ritual performed to pacify ancestral imbalances indicated in one‚Äôs horoscope. Pitra Dosh is believed to arise due to unsettled karmic debts or dissatisfaction of forefathers, often manifesting as repeated obstacles, family disputes, delays in marriage, or financial instability. The puja includes Pitra Shanti Jaap, tarpan, and special offerings conducted by learned priests according to Vedic rites. In some cases, rituals similar to pind daan are also performed to seek blessings of ancestors. Ujjain, being an ancient spiritual and astrological center on the banks of the Shipra River, is considered highly auspicious for ancestral remedies. Devotees undertake this puja to seek forgiveness, ancestral blessings, family harmony, and relief from generational obstacles

name: Break the Serpent‚Äôs Shadow with Kaal Sarp Dosh Nivaran Puja at Mangalnath

This dosha is believed to cause repeated obstacles, financial instability, career setbacks, health concerns, and mental stress. The puja includes Rahu‚ÄìKetu Shanti Jaap, special offerings, and havan conducted by experienced priests according to Vedic procedures. Ujjain, being an ancient center of astrology and spirituality, is considered highly auspicious for performing this remedy. Devotees undertake this puja to seek relief from karmic blockages, restore planetary balance, and invite stability, protection, and spiritual growth into their lives.

name: Mangal Dosh Nivaran Puja - Mangalnath Mandir, Ujjain
description: Mangal Dosh Nivaran Puja at Mangalnath Mandir, Ujjain, is a sacred ritual performed to reduce the adverse effects of Mangal (Mars) in one‚Äôs horoscope. It is especially recommended for individuals facing delays in marriage, relationship conflicts, financial instability, or recurring obstacles attributed to Mangal Dosh (also known as Kuja Dosha). The puja typically includes Mangal Grah Shanti Jaap, special offerings, and the traditional Bhaat Puja, which is considered highly effective at this temple because Ujjain is believed to be the birthplace of Mangal Grah. The ritual is most auspicious on Tuesdays, the day dedicated to Lord Mangal. Devotees perform the ceremony under the guidance of temple priests, seeking planetary balance, harmony, and overall prosperity. This puja is regarded as one of the most powerful remedies for Mangal Dosh in Hindu astrology.

description: Karungali Mala (Ebony Wood Mala) ‚Äì Black Beads with Gold-Toned Links Karungali, known as Ebony in English, is a sacred and powerful wood obtained from the Diospyros genus. name: Book a Puja - ISKCON Ghaziabad
description: 1. Bhagwan Krishna ki kripa se jeevan mein sukh aur samriddhi Har puja se milta hai divine protection aur blessings. 2. Mann ki shuddhi aur manokamna poorti Sincere puja se purane paap aur rukawatein door hoti hain. 3. Parivaar mein shanti, arogya aur vikas Krishna ki puja se ghar mein aata hai harmony aur positive growth.

name: Nandadeep Seva - Shree Balaji Temple Kurla
description: Nandadeep Seva is the lighting of a diya at Shree Balaji Temple (Kurla) for one complete day in the name of someone you wish to hono - for their and your family's well-being, lineage blessings V amshoddhara , good health, and prosperity. Benefits of Nandadeep Puja Spiritual Upliftment: Regular performance of the Nandadeep puja is believed to enhance spiritual growth and inner peace. Blessings of Lord Balaji: Devotees seek the grace of Lord Balaji for health, wealth, and overall well-being. Protection: The continuous burning of the lamp is thought to ward off negative energies and protect the household from harm. Nandadeep puja, whether performed in grand temples or humble homes, is a beautiful expression of devotion and faith, creating a direct connection between the worshippers and the divine presence of Lord Balaji.

name: Kirtan Seva - ISKCON Ghaziabad
description: This sacred time, go beyond flowers and chocolate - honor someone who has nurtured you by giving gifts that carry both meaning and purpose. At 3ioPrasadam, we believe devotion is the purest expression of love. Whether youre shopping for puja essentials or sponsoring a seva in someones name, our curated guide and four acts of kindness will help you express your gratitude in the most soulful way.

name: Gau Seva - ISKCON Ghaziabad
description: 1. Ghar mein sukh, shanti aur samriddhi Gau Mata ki seva se parivaar par banti hai bhagwan ki kripa. 2. Purvajon ke karmon ka uddhaar Ye seva ancestral blessings dilati hai aur dosh door karti hai. 3. Paap aur grah dosh se mukti Gau Seva se milti hai positive energy, protection aur spiritual upliftment.

name: Annadaan Seva - ISKCON Ghaziabad
description: 1. Bhagwan ka sabse pavitra daan Annadaan se milta hai sukh, shanti aur parivar par sadaiv divine kripa. 2. Paap aur purane karmon se mukti Bhookhon ko khilana karmic balance sudhaar kar jeevan mein positivity laata hai. 3. Ghar mein samriddhi aur raksha Is seva se ghar mein aati hai prosperity, health aur divine protection.

name: Shringar Aashirwad - Maa Mangla Gauri Shakti Peeth, Gayaji
description: Shringar Aashirwad Seva is a sacred offering where devotees present chunri , sindoor , kangan , and saree to Maa Durga during the puja. These items are offered as a gesture of devotion, reverence, and surrender to the Divine Mother. Devotees offer sacred items like chunri, sindoor, kangan, and saree to Maa Durga during the puja. How it is done :These offerings are placed before the Goddess with devotion during rituals and prayers. Why it is important: Such offerings symbolize respect, surrender, and love for the Divine Mother, invoking her blessings of prosperity, health, and harmony. All offered items are later returned to devotees as Prasad , carrying Maa Durgas divine energy and grace. Considered especially auspicious in Navratri , enhancing spiritual merit and devotion.

name: Special Abhishek - Shri Mangal Dev Grah Mandir
description: Special Abhishek is a grand and elaborate version of the traditional abhishek. It is performed with rare ingredients, elaborate chanting, and deep devotion for devotees seeking extraordinary blessings from Lord Mangal.

name: Vastra Arpan - Maa Mangla Gauri Shakti Peeth, Gayaji
description: Blessings of Maa Durga -Contributing to Vastra is a way of surrendering your devotion at the feet of Maa Durga. It invites her divine blessings for peace, prosperity, and protection in life. Divine blessings It is believed to invoke Goddess Durgas grace and blessings. Fulfillment of wishes Devotees believe sincere Prarthana brings peace, prosperity, and the fulfillment of heartfelt desires.. Strength & protection Goddess Durga is worshipped for Shakti (power), and Puja is a way to seek her protection against obstacles and evil forces.

name: Nityamangal Abhishek - Shri Mangal Dev Grah Mandir
description: Nityamangal Abhishek is a sacred daily ritual of bathing Lord Mangal with holy water, milk, and auspicious substances. Nitya means daily, and this seva represents the importance of seeking continuous blessings for a stable, protected, and prosperous life.

name: Pushpanjali- Maa Mangla Gauri Shakti Peeth, Gayaji
description: Pushpanjali is a sacred offering of flowers made to deities during puja. The word Pushpanjali comes from Sanskrit Pushpa, meaning flower, and Anjali, meaning handful offering. How it is done on-site: Devotees take flowers in their palms, usually along with bel leaves, and recite mantras after the priest. With devotion, the flowers are then offered at the feet of the Goddess as a mark of surrender and respect. How it is done off-site: The pandit offers Pushpanjali on behalf of the devotee, reciting their name and gotra during the ritual. Why it is important: Pushpanjali is considered the most heartfelt way of offering prayers to Maa Durga. It symbolizes purity, devotion, and the giving up of one's ego to seek blessings. It is believed to remove obstacles, bring peace, and invite divine grace into one's life.

name: Hawanatmak Shanti or Graha Shanti Puja - Shri Mangal Dev Grah Mandir
description: Hawanatmak Shanti is a sacred fire ritual (havan) that invokes peace, protection, and harmony. Fire (Agni Dev) is considered the purest messenger between humans and deities. This pooja is especially performed to pacify Mangal Graha, reduce Mangal Dosha, and create balance in life.

name: Panchamrit Abhishek - Shri Mangal Dev Grah Mandir
description: The Panchamrit Abhishek is a deeply purifying ritual where the idol of Lord Mangal is bathed with Panchamrit ‚Äù a sacred mixture of milk (doodh), curd (dahi), ghee, honey (madhu), and sugar (shakkar). These five elements are symbolic: milk represents purity, curd symbolizes prosperity, ghee stands for strength, honey for sweetness of life, and sugar for bliss.

name: Akhand Jyoti - Maa Mangla Gauri Shakti Peeth, Gayaji
Bhomyag or Mangal Dosh Nivaran Yajna - Shri Mangal Dev Grah Mandir
description: Pandits chant powerful Mangal Beej Mantras while sacred items such as red flowers, jaggery, ghee, and sesame are offered into the fire. The energy of Agni (fire) acts as a messenger to carry the devotees prayers to the divine. The entire ritual creates a spiritual shield around the devotee.

name: Shringar Arpan - Maa Mangla Gauri Shakti Peeth, Gayaji
description: Shringar Arpan is a special offering where devotees contribute to ornaments, sindoor, bangles, kumkum, and other adornments of Maa Durga. Scriptures describe Shringar Arpan as a way to invite the Goddesss blessings of beauty, harmony, prosperity, and protection. How it is done: The Goddess is beautifully adorned with these offerings during the puja, symbolizing devotion and respect.
